result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeromy Scott Vandyke was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeromy Scott Vandyke was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 14CF195, 15CF14, 14TR2216, 14TR2217, 14TR2218, 14TR2219, 15TR212 & 15TR213 cases called at 2:45 pm. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by DA Blader. Defendant and Attorney Szilagyi concur with reading. State withdraws the motion to forfeit bond. Amended Information addressed. Confirm receipt, waive formal reading. Entry of plea to Counts 1 & 3.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & 3 of 15CF14.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CF14 and dismisses and reads-in 14CF195, 14TR2216, 14TR2217, 14TR2218, 14TR2219, 15TR212 & 15TR213. Statement by defendant.  Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1- 10 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time credit. Credit for 45 days served. To commence immediately. $2388.50 fine inclusive of costs + $42.50 blood draw costs, bond is to be applied.  33 month DL revocation, 33 month IID, OWI Assessment. COUNT 3- 10 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Concurrent to Count 1. 45 days credit.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-05-2015 02:15 pm

14CF195 & 15CF14 Cases called @ 2:46 p.m. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Szilagyi requesting another plea/sentencing date as the defendant has moved and needs to make arrangements in the county is which he currently resides.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

14CF-195 and and 15CF-14 - Both Cases Called @ 3:41 PM: Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  INFO Stated - Counsel admit receipt - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  15CF-14:   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.   ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  State reserves the right to amend INFO on Tox Report is received.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled as to all matters - NOH Given. Initial appearance on February 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $2000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting lower cash bond. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.

14TR1678 & 14TR1679: Atty Zouski - DE has FTP warrants that need to be addressed if the defendant intends to post the cash bond.  The court finds the defendant in contempt. Court orders 30 days WCJ - I/S - Purge conditions: DE to make $50 monthly payments starting 4/1/2015.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
